casebody.data:
Gilmore, Appellant, v. Gilmore et al. Argued January 16, 1923. *334Before Frazer, Simpson, Kephart, Sadler and Schaffer, JJ. *340Edmund W. Kirby, for appellant.

An agreement to look to corporate profits for payment is valid and enforceable: Alexander v. Righter, 240 Pa. 22; Keller v. Cohen, 217 Pa. 522.

Enforcement of the agreement for payment does not destroy the obligation, on the contrary, the demand of payment contrary to the agreement constitutes fraud: Gandy v. Weckerly, 220 Pa. 285.

Joseph R. Embery, for appellees,

cited: Second Nat. Bank of Reading v. Yeager, 268 Pa. 167.

January 29, 1923: Per Curiam,

The decree in this case is affirmed on the facts found and the legal conclusions reached by the learned judge of the court below. Costs to be paid by appellant.
